subject: Re: [junit] Swing Testing
msgSnippet: Hi janarthanan, Thanks. Can you tell me one more thing, In my application the request goes from the Client via Http to the server (JBoss 2.4.4 TomCat 3.2.3)
messageBody:
Hi janarthanan,

Thanks. Can you tell me one more thing, In my
application the request goes from the Client via Http
to the server (JBoss 2.4.4 TomCat 3.2.3) where a
servlet takes the request and calls the corrosponding
business method of the session bean stated in the
request. Now i want to test that session bean. One
approach is to write a wrapper class for the business
methods of session bean which takes input XML as the
session bean receives from the client and test that
wrapper class. Is there any other way or the
workaround i stated is good enough
Regards
Arvind
--- janarthanan poornavel <rush2jana2002@...>
wrote:
>
> dear sharma,
>
> well the answer for your first question is,you
> can,but it needs hours of seeing through the code
> and knowing what does what,if you could get the
> bigger picture,you can start writing
> testcases(patience!!).
>
> the second question is a bit ambigous,well i would
> put simply it as ,with the jfcunit framework you can
> effectively do blakbox testing
>
>
>
> regards,
>
> jana
>
>
>
